eu.davidea.fastscroller

Class FastScroller

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • eu.davidea.fastscroller.FastScroller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class FastScroller
extends android.widget.FrameLayout
    Class taken from GitHub, customized and optimized for FlexibleAdapter project.
    Since:
    Up to the date 23/01/2016
    23/01/2016 Added onFastScrollerStateChange in the listener
    10/03/2017 Added autoHide, bubblePosition, bubbleEnabled, ignoreTouchesOutsideHandle (thanks to @arpinca)
    22/04/2017 Added minimum scroll threshold
    See Also:
    github.com/AndroidDeveloperLB/LollipopContactsRecyclerViewFastScroller

      private void autoHideScrollbar()
      Auto-hides the scrollbar with animation.
      long getAutoHideDelayInMillis() 
      protected int getTargetPos(float currY)
      Computes the index where the RecyclerView should be scrolled to based on the currY (y-coordinate of the touch event in the scrollbar).

      protected void hideBubble()

      Hides the scrollbar with animation.

      boolean onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent event) 
      void removeOnScrollStateChangeListener(FastScroller.OnScrollStateChangeListener stateChangeListener) 
      void setAutoHideDelayInMillis(long autoHideDelayInMillis)
      Sets the delay in milli-seconds to auto hide the scroller when untouched.
      void setAutoHideEnabled(boolean autoHideEnabled)
      Allows to auto hide the FastScroller after x-milliseconds.
      void setBubbleAndHandleColor(int color)
      Changes the color of the Bubble and Handle views.
      protected void setBubbleAndHandlePosition(float y)
      Sets the y-position of the bubble and the handle based on the current y-position.
      void setBubbleTextCreator(FastScroller.BubbleTextCreator bubbleTextCreator) 
      void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Enable and display the FastScroller OR disable and hide the FastScroller.
      void setHandleAlwaysVisible(boolean enabled)
      If enabled, it will keep handle always visible with 50% transparency.
      void setIgnoreTouchesOutsideHandle(boolean ignoreFlag)
      If enabled, it ignores touches outside handle.
      void setMinimumScrollThreshold(int dy)
      If set, it ignores small scrolls, so scroller will be shown if enough amount of scroll is reached (it mimics fling gesture).
      void setRecyclerView(androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView recyclerView)
      This is done by FlexibleAdapter already!
      protected void setRecyclerViewPosition(float y) 
      void setViewsToUse(int layoutResId, int bubbleResId, int handleResId)
      Layout customization.
      Color for Selected State is the bubbleAndHandleColor defined inside the Drawables.
      protected void showBubble() 
      void showScrollbar()
      Shows the scrollbar with animation.
      void toggleFastScroller()
      Displays or Hides the FastScroller.
      protected void updateBubbleText(int position)
      Update the text in the bubble based on the provided index.

        public void setViewsToUse(@LayoutRes
                          int layoutResId,
                          @IdRes
                          int bubbleResId,
                          @IdRes
                          int handleResId)
        Layout customization.
        Color for Selected State is the bubbleAndHandleColor defined inside the Drawables.
        Parameters:
        layoutResId - Main layout of Fast Scroller
        bubbleResId - Drawable resource for Bubble containing the Text
        handleResId - Drawable resource for the Handle

      • getTargetPos

        protected int getTargetPos(float currY)
        Computes the index where the RecyclerView should be scrolled to based on the currY (y-coordinate of the touch event in the scrollbar).
        Parameters:
        currY - y-coordinate of the touch event in the scrollbar
        Returns:
        index position in the RecyclerView

      • updateBubbleText

        protected void updateBubbleText(int position)
        Update the text in the bubble based on the provided index.

        Override this method if you want to do something different when displaying the text in the bubble e.g. display a different text when the result of onCreateBubbleText is empty; OR apply different format depending on the result of onCreateBubbleText.

        The text can be set by calling: 
         ...
 String bubbleTextString = bubbleTextCreator.onCreateBubbleText(index);
 bubble.setText(bubbleTextString);
 ...
        Parameters:
        position - position of the object that will be reflected in the bubble

      • getValueInRange

        protected static int getValueInRange(int min,
                                     int max,
                                     int value)

      • setBubbleAndHandlePosition

        protected void setBubbleAndHandlePosition(float y)
        Sets the y-position of the bubble and the handle based on the current y-position. Override this method if you want to adjust the min and max position of the handle and the bubble. E.g. the max position of the bubble is the same as the max position of the handle.
        Parameters:
        y - current active y height in the scrollbar

      • isAutoHideEnabled

        public boolean isAutoHideEnabled()

      • setAutoHideEnabled

        public void setAutoHideEnabled(boolean autoHideEnabled)
        Allows to auto hide the FastScroller after x-milliseconds.

        Default value is true.

        Parameters:
        autoHideEnabled - true to enable auto Hide, false to disable
        See Also:
        setAutoHideDelayInMillis(long), setMinimumScrollThreshold(int)

      • getAutoHideDelayInMillis

        public long getAutoHideDelayInMillis()

      • setAutoHideDelayInMillis

        public void setAutoHideDelayInMillis(long autoHideDelayInMillis)
        Sets the delay in milli-seconds to auto hide the scroller when untouched.

        Default value is 1000ms.

        Parameters:
        autoHideDelayInMillis - value in milli-seconds

      • setIgnoreTouchesOutsideHandle

        public void setIgnoreTouchesOutsideHandle(boolean ignoreFlag)
        If enabled, it ignores touches outside handle.

        Default value is false.

        Parameters:
        ignoreFlag - true to ignore touches outside handle
        Since:
        5.0.0-rc2

      • setHandleAlwaysVisible

        public void setHandleAlwaysVisible(boolean enabled)
        If enabled, it will keep handle always visible with 50% transparency.

        Default value is false.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true to keep the handle always visible, false to hide always
        Since:
        5.0.5

      • setMinimumScrollThreshold

        public void setMinimumScrollThreshold(int dy)
        If set, it ignores small scrolls, so scroller will be shown if enough amount of scroll is reached (it mimics fling gesture).
        • It works only if AutoHide is enabled.
        • Good values are between 60 and 100 pixel on real devices.
        Default value is 0 (scroller is always shown at each scroll amount).
        Parameters:
        dy - minimum scroll amount to show the scroller.
        Since:
        5.0.0-rc2

      • showScrollbar

        public void showScrollbar()
        Shows the scrollbar with animation.
        Since:
        5.0.0-rc2
        See Also:

      • toggleFastScroller

        public void toggleFastScroller()
        Displays or Hides the FastScroller.
        The action is animated.
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        setEnabled(boolean)

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable and display the FastScroller OR disable and hide the FastScroller.

        If autoHide is enabled, showing the FastScrollbar will trigger autoHide.

        Overrides:
        setEnabled in class android.view.View
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable and show, false to hide with animation.
        See Also:
        toggleFastScroller()
